content: Cabinet of Singapore since 2025 The **Second Cabinet of Lawrence Wong** of the [Government of Singapore](/wiki/Government_of_Singapore) was announced on 21 May 2025, and came into effect on 23 May 2025. ## Changes Upon his successful [supermajority](/wiki/Supermajority) in the [2025 general election](/wiki/2025_Singaporean_general_election), [Lawrence Wong](/wiki/Lawrence_Wong) stated that his immediate priority was to form the new cabinet, which will be announced "in due course" through a press conference and followed by a swearing-in ceremony. He also indicated that NTUC secretary-general [Ng Chee Meng](/wiki/Ng_Chee_Meng) was likely to be included, citing the precedent of labour chiefs playing key roles in past Cabinets. On 5 May, Wong also announced that [Workers' Party](/wiki/Workers%27_Party_(Singapore))'s (WP) [Pritam Singh](/wiki/Pritam_Singh) would remain as the [opposition leader](/wiki/Leader_of_the_Opposition_(Singapore)). After a photo of Ng and convicted money launderer [Su Haijin](/wiki/Su_Haijin) was circulated online, Ng requested on 6 May for Wong not to assign him any cabinet position. Ng also apologised for his "disrespectful" remarks made to public servants at a 2017 [Ministry of Education](/wiki/Ministry_of_Education_(Singapore)) dialogue. Wong announced the new cabinet line-up on 21 May. Three new coordinating ministers were appointed with [Gan Kim Yong](/wiki/Gan_Kim_Yong) as the only [Deputy Prime Minister](/wiki/Deputy_Prime_Minister_of_Singapore). [Chan Chun Sing](/wiki/Chan_Chun_Sing) assumed roles as defence minister and coordinating minister for public services, while [Desmond Lee](/wiki/Desmond_Lee_(Singaporean_politician)) took over education and [Chee Hong Tat](/wiki/Chee_Hong_Tat) became the national development minister. [Ong Ye Kung](/wiki/Ong_Ye_Kung) became coordinating minister for social policies, and [K. Shanmugam](/wiki/K._Shanmugam) was appointed coordinating minister for national security, with [Edwin Tong](/wiki/Edwin_Tong) taking over law and also serving as second minister for home affairs. [Muhammad Faishal Ibrahim](/wiki/Muhammad_Faishal_Ibrahim) was promoted to senior minister of state for home affairs and acting minister-in-charge of Muslim affairs. Newly-elected Members of Parliament (MP) [Jeffrey Siow](/wiki/Jeffrey_Siow) and [David Neo](/wiki/David_Neo) became acting ministers for transport and culture, community and youth respectively. Wong added that Ng's exclusion from the new Cabinet was a "temporary arrangement" but hoped to include him into the cabinet soon. MinisterAppointment[K. Shanmugam](/wiki/K._Shanmugam)[Coordinating Minister for National Security](/wiki/Coordinating_Minister_for_National_Security_(Singapore)) and [Minister for Home Affairs](/wiki/Minister_for_Home_Affairs_(Singapore))[Chan Chun Sing](/wiki/Chan_Chun_Sing)Coordinating Minister for Public Services and [Minister for Defence](/wiki/Minister_for_Defence_(Singapore))[Ong Ye Kung](/wiki/Ong_Ye_Kung)[Coordinating Minister for Social Policies](/wiki/Coordinating_Minister_for_Social_Policies) and [Minister for Health](/wiki/Minister_for_Health_(Singapore))[Desmond Lee](/wiki/Desmond_Lee_(Singaporean_politician))[Minister for Education](/wiki/Minister_for_Education_(Singapore)) and Minister In-Charge of Social Services Integration[Edwin Tong](/wiki/Edwin_Tong)[Minister for Law](/wiki/Minister_for_Law_(Singapore)) and [Second Minister for Home Affairs](/wiki/Minister_for_Home_Affairs_(Singapore))[Tan See Leng](/wiki/Tan_See_Leng)Minister-In-Charge of Energy and Science & Technology and [Minister for Manpower](/wiki/Minister_for_Manpower_(Singapore))[Chee Hong Tat](/wiki/Chee_Hong_Tat)[Minister for National Development](/wiki/Minister_for_National_Development_(Singapore))[David Neo](/wiki/David_Neo)Acting [Minister for Culture, Community and Youth](/wiki/Ministry_of_Culture,_Community_and_Youth) and Senior Minister of State for Education[Jeffrey Siow](/wiki/Jeffrey_Siow)Acting [Minister for Transport](/wiki/Minister_for_Transport_(Singapore)) and Senior Minister of State for Finance[Muhammad Faishal Ibrahim](/wiki/Muhammad_Faishal_Ibrahim)[Acting Minister-in-charge of Muslim Affairs](/wiki/Minister-in-charge_of_Muslim_Affairs) and Senior Minister of State for Home Affairs ## Composition The cabinet was sworn in on 23 May 2025. The Second Lawrence Wong Cabinet is composed of the following members.
